page.title: 17Religion in the Villages
page.content: The only church buildings in each village belong to the{Church of {England}but some residents worship in other churches and there is, at least one family belonging to another world faith.Our Vicar says "A remarkably fine{Saxon Crosshead}witnesses to the presence of{Christian faith}in {Cropthorne}long before the original Domesday,"This parish,smaller now than it used to be,still has a parish priest which it shares with Charlton, though he no longer possesses the freehold.He and the Parochial Church Council care for an ancient building with a Norman nave.Often congregations are small but above national average. The P.C.C.is concerned,not only to continue the tradition of faith,but also with wider issues as varied as unemployment in this country and deprivation in the third world.
